raw:
```json
{
  "file": "Login.aspx.cs",
  "vulnerabilities": [
    {
      "title": "Insecure JWT Handling",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-352",
      "description": "The JWT is generated and stored in a cookie without proper validation of the claims or expiration. If the JWT is compromised, an attacker could impersonate the user.",
      "line_numbers": [36, 37],
      "recommendation": "Implement proper validation of the JWT claims and ensure that the token is signed with a strong secret. Consider using a library that handles JWT securely."
    },
    {
      "title": "Potential Information Disclosure",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-209",
      "description": "The application provides a generic error message for invalid credentials, which could lead to information disclosure about valid usernames.",
      "line_numbers": [24, 45],
      "recommendation": "Implement a more generic error message that does not disclose whether the username or password was incorrect."
    },
    {
      "title": "Session Fixation",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-384",
      "description": "The application does not invalidate the previous session upon successful login, which could allow an attacker to hijack a session.",
      "line_numbers": [30],
      "recommendation": "Invalidate the previous session and create a new session upon successful authentication."
    },
    {
      "title": "Lack of Rate Limiting",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-770",
      "description": "The application does not implement any rate limiting on login attempts, making it susceptible to brute force attacks.",
      "line_numbers": [20],
      "recommendation": "Implement rate limiting on login attempts to mitigate brute force attacks."
    }
  ]
}
```
